title: Week 1: Course Introduction and Overview of Machine Learning
description: An introduction to the course, covering the fundamentals of machine learning and its importance in various applications.

title: Week 2: Data Preprocessing
description: An exploration of data preprocessing techniques essential for preparing raw data for machine learning applications.

title: Week 3: Feature Engineering
description: A deep dive into feature engineering, discussing methods to enhance model performance through the selection and transformation of data features.

title: Week 4: Introduction to Supervised Learning: Linear Regression
description: An introduction to supervised learning, focusing on linear regression as a foundational algorithm for predictive modeling.

title: Week 5: Supervised Learning: Logistic Regression
description: An examination of logistic regression, detailing its application in binary classification problems.

title: Week 6: Decision Trees and Ensemble Methods
description: A study of decision trees and ensemble methods, including techniques like random forests to improve predictive accuracy.

title: Week 7: Neural Networks Basics
description: An introduction to the basics of neural networks, exploring their structure and learning mechanisms.

title: Week 8: Model Evaluation and Tuning
description: Discussion on important concepts in model evaluation, including metrics for performance assessment and techniques for tuning models.

title: Week 9: Fall Break
description: No classes this week; students are encouraged to use this time for self-study and preparation.

title: Week 10: Introduction to Unsupervised Learning: Clustering
description: An introduction to unsupervised learning techniques, particularly clustering, and their applications in data analysis.

title: Week 11: Dimensionality Reduction Techniques
description: Exploration of methods for dimensionality reduction, including PCA, to simplify models and improve interpretability.

title: Week 12: Unsupervised Learning: Applications and Interpretations
description: A study of various applications of unsupervised learning and how to interpret results from these analyses.

title: Week 13: Neural Networks and Deep Learning
description: In-depth coverage of neural networks and their evolution into deep learning architectures, including practical applications.

title: Week 14: Advanced Topics: Transfer Learning, Explainability in AI
description: A look at advanced machine learning topics such as transfer learning and the importance of explainability in AI models.

title: Week 15: Project Preparation and Review
description: Preparation for the capstone project with reviews and group work to finalize project concepts and presentations.

title: Week 16: Capstone Project Presentations
description: Final presentations of the capstone projects where students demonstrate their understanding of machine learning by applying it to real-world problems.
